title: Jesus' Trial
description: The Praetorium was likely the site where Jesus stood trial before Pontius Pilate. Archaeological remains near Herod’s palace—such as the stone pavement and judgment platform—match biblical accounts of the trial.

title: Earliest-Discovered Use of the Name ‘Yahweh’
description: Soleb Inscription – A 1400 BCE Egyptian temple names “Yahweh” in reference to nomads, likely early Israelites, supporting the biblical Exodus timeline.

title: Giant-Sized Spearhead Linked to Gath
description: A 2kg, 66cm copper spearhead from the Monash hoard echoes 1 Samuel’s account of Goliath’s massive weapon—offering rare, tangible evidence of biblical-scale warriors.

title: Site of Jesus' Crucifixion
description: The Church of the Holy Sepulchre in Jerusalem is believed to be the site of Jesus' crucifixion, burial, and resurrection. It is one of the most sacred places in Christianity.
